logic.notes: Hernia repair requires documented hernia with symptoms or complications; age 5-85
Incisional/ventral hernia repair requires documented hernia with functional impairment
Umbilical/epigastric hernia repair requires symptomatic hernia or complications
Laparoscopic appendectomy requires acute appendicitis with clinical symptoms
Open appendectomy requires complicated appendicitis or contraindication to laparoscopy
Appendectomy with cecectomy requires neoplasm or complex pathology
Laparoscopic cholecystectomy requires symptomatic gallbladder disease or complications
Open cholecystectomy requires acute complications or contraindication to laparoscopy
Bile duct exploration requires documented stones or stricture with ERCP failure
Hemorrhoidectomy requires grade 3-4 hemorrhoids with failed conservative management
Stapled hemorrhoidopexy (PPH) requires prolapsing internal hemorrhoids grade 2-3
Thrombosed hemorrhoid excision requires acute thrombosis within 72 hours
Hemorrhoid injection sclerotherapy requires bleeding grade 1-2 internal hemorrhoids
Infrared coagulation requires bleeding internal hemorrhoids grade 1-2
Low anterior resection requires rectal cancer with appropriate staging and oncology evaluation
Abdominoperineal resection requires low rectal cancer when sphincter preservation not possible
Total mesorectal excision requires mid/low rectal cancer with oncologic principles
Transanal excision requires early T1 rectal cancer with favorable histologic features
Pelvic exenteration requires locally advanced rectal cancer with multidisciplinary evaluation
Colectomy for IBD requires failed medical management and gastroenterology evaluation
Ileocecal resection requires localized Crohns disease with failed medical therapy
Stricturoplasty requires Crohns strictures with obstructive symptoms and imaging
IPAA requires ulcerative colitis with sphincter function assessment and patient counseling
Perianal fistula repair requires MRI evaluation and medical optimization for Crohns
Sleeve to bypass revision requires failed sleeve gastrectomy with inadequate weight loss or severe GERD
Band removal with conversion requires band complications or failure with comprehensive evaluation
Gastric bypass revision requires complications including leak, stricture, obstruction, or hemorrhage
Revision for weight regain requires >50% regain of lost weight with comprehensive evaluation
Pouch or sleeve dilation repair requires symptomatic anatomical changes affecting outcomes
Roux-en-Y gastric bypass requires BMI ≥40 or ≥35 with comorbidities and comprehensive evaluation
Gastric bypass for diabetes management requires inadequate glycemic control despite optimal medical therapy
Open gastric bypass requires conversion from laparoscopic or technical contraindications
Enhanced malabsorptive gastric bypass for super-obesity or severe metabolic syndrome
Gastric bypass requires comprehensive postoperative management with multidisciplinary team follow-up
Laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy requires BMI ≥40 or ≥35 with comorbidities and multidisciplinary evaluation
Adolescent sleeve gastrectomy requires severe obesity with comprehensive evaluation and family support
Sleeve gastrectomy with comorbidity management requires obesity with poorly controlled diabetes, sleep apnea, or hypertension
Sleeve gastrectomy requires preoperative medical clearance, nutritional assessment, and accredited center
Primary ACL reconstruction requires complete ACL tear with functional instability in active individuals
Rotator cuff repair for athletes requires repairable tears with overhead activity requirements
Shoulder labral repair for recurrent instability in young athletes with overhead sports participation
Achilles tendon repair for acute ruptures in active individuals within 2 weeks of injury
UCL reconstruction (Tommy John surgery) for overhead throwing athletes with complete UCL tears
Knee arthroscopy for meniscal repair requires MRI confirmation and failed conservative treatment for 6+ weeks
Shoulder arthroscopy for rotator cuff repair requires MRI confirmation and failed conservative management
Hip arthroscopy for labral repair requires MRI confirmation and failed conservative treatment in young active patients
Ankle arthroscopy requires imaging confirmation and 3+ months failed conservative treatment
Elbow arthroscopy requires refractory lateral epicondylitis after 6+ months conservative treatment
Hip fracture ORIF requires displaced femoral neck or intertrochanteric fractures with urgent surgical repair
Ankle fracture ORIF requires displaced malleolar fractures needing anatomic reduction for joint stability
Wrist fracture ORIF requires displaced distal radius fractures with articular involvement or instability
Clavicle fracture ORIF requires displaced fractures >2cm displacement or significant comminution
Femur fracture intramedullary nailing for femoral shaft fractures enabling early mobilization and weight bearing
Primary total knee arthroplasty requires severe osteoarthritis with functional limitation and failed conservative treatment
Primary total hip arthroplasty requires severe arthritis, fracture, or AVN with failed conservative management
Total shoulder arthroplasty requires severe glenohumeral arthritis with intact or repairable rotator cuff
Revision knee arthroplasty requires prosthetic complications including loosening, infection, or osteolysis
Unicompartmental knee arthroplasty requires isolated compartment disease with intact ACL and normal alignment
Craniotomy for tumor resection requires confirmed brain tumor with mass effect or neurological symptoms
Craniotomy for hematoma evacuation requires symptomatic intracranial hematoma with mass effect
Epilepsy surgery requires intractable seizures with failed medical management and epilepsy center evaluation
Aneurysm clipping requires ruptured aneurysm or high-risk unruptured aneurysm with neurosurgical evaluation
Trigeminal neuralgia surgery requires refractory facial pain with failed medical management
Ventriculoperitoneal shunt placement requires confirmed hydrocephalus with ventricular enlargement and symptoms
Shunt revision requires documented shunt malfunction, infection, or mechanical failure with imaging
Shunt removal or externalization requires infected shunt or need for temporary external drainage
Ventriculostomy requires acute hydrocephalus or need for intracranial pressure monitoring
Endoscopic third ventriculostomy requires obstructive hydrocephalus suitable for ETV procedure
DBS for Parkinson's disease requires advanced disease with motor fluctuations and failed optimal medical therapy
DBS for essential tremor requires disabling tremor refractory to medical management with functional impairment
DBS for dystonia requires generalized or medication-refractory dystonia with significant functional disability
DBS generator replacement requires battery depletion or generator malfunction with documented need
DBS lead revision requires documented lead malfunction, migration, or inadequate therapeutic response
